results.brief_description: Based on a chapter from the book “The Sun on the Stubble” by Colin Thiele. results.title: Orthogonal projection (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Allen Downs, Art Landy, Don Gangloff, Jay Hines and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geometry”.
Introduces an elementary transformation involving triangles transformed into a problem involving conics. Uses certain fundamental geometric notions such as division of line segments into given ratios, in variance under transformations, conic sections etc. which are encountered in other parts of geometry.

results.title: Spain: the land and the people
results.brief_description: The film begins by describing Madrid, the capital, including buildings etc, then takes the viewer to Seville in the south of Spain. Maps indicate the nature of the country, consisting mainly of a high plateau. Products include port wine, oranges, raisins, leather, minerals, olives, olive oil etc. Glimpses are shown of a Spanish family at home and at work, the children at school, their games etc.

results.title: The Double-spandrel bridge
results.brief_description: China has a long history in bridge building, but the cross curved arch bridge or the “double spandrel bridge” is a new breakthrough in the history of China’s bridge construction. Easy, quick and inexpensive to build, and full of national characteristics, it economises on materials and facilitates transport and communications. Shows the development and construction of some of China’s 1,200 double spandrel bridges. In English with Chinese and English subtitles.

results.title: Man hunt
results.creator_credit: Peter Robinson, Reed Executive Selection and Video Arts
results.brief_description: Outlines how to conduct effective staff selection interviews. John Cleese portrays the managers, Ethel the Unready, Ivan the Terrible and William the Silent who show the common mistakes of lack of preparation, failure to encourage the candidate to talk openly and relevantly and failing to introduce direct and probing questions. Norman Bowler demonstrates the correct interview techniques.

They investigate every visible form and shape until they recover the vital black stripe of their own.

results.title: Yuzen kimono
results.brief_description: Shows how the Yuzen-Kimono is made in Kyoto. We follow the process from the designing and making of the wide variety of beautiful hand painted materials, the hand sewing of the traditional kimonos and finally the wearing of them by children and women of all ages on special occasions in the ancient city of Kyoto. Without commentary - music only with English intertitles.
